intro: Anthephora abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian anthephora, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
